title: Conus zylmanae
text:
Conus zylmanae is a species of <a href="sea%20snail">sea snail</a>, a marine <a href="gastropod">gastropod</a> <a href="mollusk">mollusk</a> in the <a href="family%20%28biology%29">family</a> <a href="Conidae">Conidae</a>, the <a href="Conus">cone snails</a> and their allies.
Like all species within the genus "Conus", these snails are <a href="predatory">predatory</a> and <a href="venomous">venomous</a>. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
Distribution.
This species occurs in the Atlantic Ocean off the <a href="Bahamas">Bahamas</a>.
Description.
The maximum recorded <a href="gastropod%20shell">shell</a> length is 24 mm.
Habitat.
Minimum recorded depth is 6 m. Maximum recorded depth is 7 m.
